intro: Bidens sharpii, commonly known as the sharpleaf tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, often forming dense stands in disturbed areas. Its leaves are narrow and sharply pointed, giving it its common name, while its yellow flowers bloom in the summer. Bidens sharpii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
